item.title: Tree needs pruning and the pavement is, 25th August
item.description:
Dear Bromley Council, I am writing to formally raise a concern regarding a council-owned tree located adjacent to our property. The tree is causing several issues that require urgent attention: Encroachment onto property – The branches have grown extensively and are now reaching into our property, creating potential risk of damage and obstruction. Uneven pavement – The tree roots have lifted and displaced the pavement, making the surface uneven and hazardous for pedestrians. Signs of disease – The tree appears to be in poor health, with visible signs of decay. This raises concerns about its stability and the possibility of falling branches. Given the risks to both public safety and private property, I kindly request that the council carry out an immediate inspection of the tree and take the necessary steps to address these issues. I would appreciate confirmation of receipt of this complaint and an indication of when an inspection or remedial work will be scheduled. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Yours sincerely, Olatz

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forster Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Toilet and Overflowing Collection Point at 13 marine drive se18 5sd, 25th August
item.description:
I am writing to report an urgent issue at my property: after flushing the toilet, the waste is not draining properly. Upon checking, it appears that the outside collection point / sewer is full, preventing proper drainage. This is causing significant inconvenience and poses a hygiene and health risk. I kindly request that this issue be treated as urgent and addressed as soon as possible. Details: • Address: 13 marine drive se18 5sd • Contact Number: +44 7472 306185 • Issue: Toilet not flushing, waste not draining, outside collection point full Please confirm when a repair team can attend. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cambridge Barracks Road, Charlton Riverside, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Absolutely shocking mess all over the place, 25th August
item.description:
It's absolutely shocking and extremely disturbing the filthy and messy streets and pavements on Kelly Avenue and Watts Street corner. Please ask the council Street cleaning manager to arrange for our streets and pavements to be cleaned every single day as it gets filthy almost every single night because some horrible and disrespectful irresponsible individual leaves her rubbish bag full of food waste on the floor next to rubbish bins. It's absolutely unacceptable disgusting and extremely disturbing and annoying that this individual does such awful thing such as FLYTIPPING on our Street leaving rubbish bag on the street instead of putting the rubbish bag full of filthy food waste inside the rubbish bin. It's absolutely unbearable and excessive and such constant chaos and filthy messy streets and pavements is against the Health and Safety regulations. Please urgently remove rubbish from Watts Street and Kelly Avenue. And please do something really helpful and effective in the long run, so we can live in comfortable healthy and clean environment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Watts Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
